forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog after 4am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 50. South southwest wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog before 7am. Sunny. High near 68, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 2 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the clock lingers early into Monday, the San Francisco skyline, cloaked in a gentle veil of fog and the remnants of the night, hints at what lies ahead. The forecasts suggest patchy fog will mingle with the dawn until 7 a.m., but its grip will soon release, giving way to the sun’s warm embrace. The temperature, a soothing balm, will rise to around 68 degrees, and one can expect a soft breeze dancing from the south-southwest, whispering sweet nothings through the city’s streets.

The day promises clarity, yet there remains an air of mystery as the sun takes its rightful place, casting a golden light on the urban landscape. With the fog retreating, you might see the Golden Gate Bridge standing proud and accessible, inviting a leisurely stroll along its span. Dressing in layers will be wise; a light jacket accompanied by breathable fabrics will keep you comfortable through the shifting temperatures. Perhaps a visit to a cozy café, where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee mingles with the gentle sounds of morning chatter, would commence a perfect day in this vibrant city. Should the sun reveal its strength, a walk through Golden Gate Park would be a splendid choice, with blooming flora waiting to offer their cheerful hues.
